Do stock returns differ depending on the day of the week? Let's use BIST100 returns to try to determine whether there is a difference.

The data you can access by downloading the *post1.xlsx* file from [here](https://github.com/urazakgul/handsonrpy/tree/main/posts/data) is from Reuters.

# R


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
library(readxl)
library(lubridate)
library(dplyr)
library(ggplot2)
library(ggthemes)
library(scales)
library(ggrepel)
```
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
bist100 <- read_excel("data.xlsx")
bist100$DATE <- ymd(bist100$DATE)

#head(bist100)
```
:::

::: {.cell}
::: {.cell-output-display}
|DATE       |    CLOSE|
|:----------|--------:|
|2002-12-31 | 103.6992|
|2003-01-02 | 105.9858|
|2003-01-03 | 108.3753|
|2003-01-06 | 103.5734|
|2003-01-07 |  97.5286|
|2003-01-08 | 101.6121|
:::
:::


How to calculate rates of return:


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
bist100 <- bist100 %>%
mutate(
    DAY = weekdays(DATE)
)

#head(bist100)
```
:::

::: {.cell}
::: {.cell-output-display}
|DATE       |    CLOSE|DAY       |
|:----------|--------:|:---------|
|2002-12-31 | 103.6992|Tuesday   |
|2003-01-02 | 105.9858|Thursday  |
|2003-01-03 | 108.3753|Friday    |
|2003-01-06 | 103.5734|Monday    |
|2003-01-07 |  97.5286|Tuesday   |
|2003-01-08 | 101.6121|Wednesday |
:::
:::


$$
r_i = \frac{P_{t+1}-P_t}{P_t} = \frac{P_{t+1}}{P_t} - 1
$$

$$
r_i = Return\ on\ a\ stock\ i
$$

$$
P_t = Price\ of\ the\ stock\ at\ time\ t
$$

$$
P_{t+1} = Price\ of\ the\ stock\ at\ time\ t+1
$$


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
bist100 <- bist100 %>%
mutate(
    RETURN = lag(lead(CLOSE) / CLOSE - 1)
) %>%
na.omit()

#head(bist100)
```
:::

::: {.cell}
::: {.cell-output-display}
|DATE       |    CLOSE|DAY       |     RETURN|
|:----------|--------:|:---------|----------:|
|2003-01-02 | 105.9858|Thursday  |  0.0220503|
|2003-01-03 | 108.3753|Friday    |  0.0225455|
|2003-01-06 | 103.5734|Monday    | -0.0443081|
|2003-01-07 |  97.5286|Tuesday   | -0.0583625|
|2003-01-08 | 101.6121|Wednesday |  0.0418698|
|2003-01-09 | 102.2582|Thursday  |  0.0063585|
:::
:::


The mean and standard deviation of returns based on weekdays:


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
result <- bist100 %>%
group_by(DAY) %>%
summarise(
    r_mean = mean(RETURN),
    r_sd = sd(RETURN)
) %>%
ungroup() %>%
mutate(
    DAY = factor(
        DAY,
        levels = c(
            "Monday",
            "Tuesday",
            "Wednesday",
            "Thursday",
            "Friday"
        )
    )
) %>%
arrange(DAY)

#result
```
:::

::: {.cell}
::: {.cell-output-display}
|DAY       |    r_mean|      r_sd|
|:---------|---------:|---------:|
|Monday    | 0.0010109| 0.0198846|
|Tuesday   | 0.0008139| 0.0164530|
|Wednesday | 0.0005155| 0.0155066|
|Thursday  | 0.0009036| 0.0173621|
|Friday    | 0.0011200| 0.0152668|
:::
:::


Barplot (Average Returns):


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
ggplot(result, aes(x = DAY, y = r_mean, fill = r_mean)) +
geom_col() +
theme_fivethirtyeight() +
theme(
    legend.position = "none",
    plot.title = element_text(hjust = .5, size = 10)
) +
scale_fill_gradient(low = "orange", high = "red") +
scale_y_continuous(labels = comma) +
labs(
    title = "What Are the Best and Worst Days of the Week for Returns for the BIST100?"
)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](index_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-10-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::


Scatterplot (Average Returns vs Standard Deviations):


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
ggplot(result, aes(x = r_mean, y = r_sd)) +
geom_point(size = 5, alpha = .5) +
geom_text_repel(aes(label = DAY)) +
theme_fivethirtyeight() +
theme(
    axis.title = element_text()
) +
scale_y_continuous(labels = comma) +
scale_x_continuous(labels = comma) +
labs(
    x = "Average",
    y = "Standard Deviation"
)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](index_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-11-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::


# Python


::: {.cell}

```{.python .cell-code}

import pandas as pd
import seaborn as sns
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
plt.style.use('fivethirtyeight')
```
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.python .cell-code}

bist100 = pd.read_excel("data.xlsx")
bist100.head()
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
        DATE     CLOSE
0 2002-12-31  103.6992
1 2003-01-02  105.9858
2 2003-01-03  108.3753
3 2003-01-06  103.5734
4 2003-01-07   97.5286
```
:::
:::


How to calculate rates of return:


::: {.cell}

```{.python .cell-code}

bist100['DAY'] = bist100['DATE'].dt.day_name()
bist100.head()
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
        DATE     CLOSE       DAY
0 2002-12-31  103.6992   Tuesday
1 2003-01-02  105.9858  Thursday
2 2003-01-03  108.3753    Friday
3 2003-01-06  103.5734    Monday
4 2003-01-07   97.5286   Tuesday
```
:::
:::


$$
r_i = \frac{P_{t+1}-P_t}{P_t} = \frac{P_{t+1}}{P_t} - 1
$$

$$
r_i = Return\ on\ a\ stock\ i
$$

$$
P_t = Price\ of\ the\ stock\ at\ time\ t
$$

$$
P_{t+1} = Price\ of\ the\ stock\ at\ time\ t+1
$$


::: {.cell}

```{.python .cell-code}

bist100['RETURN'] = bist100['CLOSE'].pct_change()
bist100 = bist100.dropna()
bist100.head()
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
        DATE     CLOSE        DAY    RETURN
1 2003-01-02  105.9858   Thursday  0.022050
2 2003-01-03  108.3753     Friday  0.022545
3 2003-01-06  103.5734     Monday -0.044308
4 2003-01-07   97.5286    Tuesday -0.058362
5 2003-01-08  101.6121  Wednesday  0.041870
```
:::
:::


The mean and standard deviation of returns based on weekdays:


::: {.cell}

```{.python .cell-code}

r_mean = bist100.groupby('DAY')['RETURN'].mean()
r_std = bist100.groupby('DAY')['RETURN'].std()

result = pd.DataFrame()
result['r_mean'] = r_mean
result['r_std'] = r_std

result.reset_index(inplace = True)

result['DAY'] = result['DAY'].astype("category")

day_list = [
    'Monday',
    'Tuesday',
    'Wednesday',
    'Thursday',
    'Friday'
]

result['DAY'] = result['DAY'].cat.reorder_categories(day_list)

result['DAY']
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
0       Friday
1       Monday
2     Thursday
3      Tuesday
4    Wednesday
Name: DAY, dtype: category
Categories (5, object): ['Monday', 'Tuesday', 'Wednesday', 'Thursday', 'Friday']
```
:::
:::


Barplot (Average Returns):


::: {.cell}

```{.python .cell-code}

fig = plt.figure(figsize = (10, 7))
bplt = sns.barplot(
    x = 'DAY',
    y = 'r_mean',
    data = result,
    palette = 'rocket'
)
bplt.set_title(
    label = 'What Are the Best and Worst Days of the Week for Returns for the BIST100?',
    fontsize = 15
)
bplt.set_xlabel(xlabel = '')
bplt.set_ylabel(ylabel = '')
plt.show()
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](index_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-17-1.png){width=960}
:::
:::


Scatterplot (Average Returns vs Standard Deviations):


::: {.cell}

```{.python .cell-code}

day = result['DAY']
r_mean_x = result['r_mean']
r_std_y = result['r_std']

fig = plt.figure(figsize = (10, 7))
splt = sns.scatterplot(
    x = 'r_mean',
    y = 'r_std',
    data = result,
    s = 150,
    alpha = .5
)
for i, day in enumerate (day):
    plt.annotate(
        day, (r_mean_x[i], r_std_y[i])
    )
splt.set_xlabel(xlabel = 'Average', size = 8)
splt.set_ylabel(ylabel = 'Standard Deviation', size = 8)
plt.show()
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](index_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-18-3.png){width=960}
:::
:::
